1.content: John was running late for his presentation on the Reaping, which was only a few short months away. District (Enter Number Here, Preferably 1 or 2) always held a grand reaping ceremony. It may have been only 6:20 in the morning, but his presentation to the Organization Department heads that were appointed to prepare the 73rd Reaping of the 12 Districts had been scheduled for 7:10 AM. That may seem to be plenty of time to get there, except that John lived 30 blocks away from his new job, and had yet to buy a closer apartment. He was just a couple of blocks from his office building when, from out of the nearby alley, came forward a large group of mysterious dark and hooded figures, and John felt strange and powerful energies coming from several of them.
1.title: The Beginning of The End of Panem

12.content: ???: "You who has seen us, we have a message for your 'President' Snow. We are a collaborative whose members hail from a multitude of worlds, times, races, species, and even universes. We have come to initiate the utter destruction and obliteration of your so-called 'Panem'. All we ask is that you successfully deliver this message to your superiors and guarantee that it reaches your overlord. Do this one task, and we will never bother you from this point onwards."
12.title: A Message for the President

1211.content: Meanwhile, in one of the 12 official Districts, a Stranger in a plain dark robe appears at noon on a mission to liberate the 12 Disricts, then join with his accumulated allies from across the Multiverse in the ULTIMATE assualt on THE CAPITOL OF PANEM. He is immediately spotted by the District's Peacekeepers, and lets himself be captured. Then, when the local chief asks him who he is and where he is from, the Stranger responds with only seven words: "I am here to kill the President." The security chief first looks at him with horror, then says after he abruptly stops laughing:" Kill him." The Peacekeepers then draw their rifles, and the Stranger laughs at this pathetic attempt to stop him, and proceeds to draw a pair of flaming knives that appeared on his belt. The Stranger then calmly slit the Peacekeepers' throats with a cold and lethal precision. He then speaks to the now terrified and shocked Chief:" WHO'S LAUGHING NOW, HUH!? YOL BAH!!!!!" The Stranger's Shout first set the helpless chief alight with a pure, white flame, and his screams were then amplified as he was then elecrocuted. The chief's death scream and the sudden powerful heat thunderstorm then drew the attention of every Peacekeeper in the District, and they proceeded to take up firing positions around the Security building as they listened to the screams of horror emitted by their comrades who were unfortunate enough to be in the building at the same moment when the Stranger was killing his interrogators. The doomed Peacekeepers then heard a strange sound of pulsing energy after the last trapped Peacekeeper was killed.
1211.title: In the 12 districts

1521.content: Do you want to continue with 1-4, or see what's going on in The Capitol itself?

choices: Kestrel and the Gamemakers are Interrupted
15212.content:
Kestrel Overwhill walked down the hallway of his facility. His assistant, Katri, quickly walked up to him, carrying a hand-held messaging device. "Dr. Overhill..." Katri began.

Kestrel stopped and turn to look at her. He smiled, and gave a soft chuckle. "Please, Katri," he said. "You know we're on first-name terms."

"True," she said, "but I want to call you 'doctor' in front of the Gamemakers. It'll look more official."

"Whatever you like, Katri, whatever you like," said Kestrel. He was to meet the Gamemakers today, in order to discuss the next Hunger Games. He had heard that it would take place in an abandoned city, and already had a few ideas. However, he'd wait to propose them at the end of the meeting, after the Gamemakers had given him their suggestions. They were an egotistical bunch, and each one of them seemed to think that they could do Kestrel's job better than him. Kestrel was a Genetic Engineer (or mutt-maker, as some people called it) who designed the creatures used in the Hunger Games. He'd only done it for a few years, but he had already established himself as one of the best. He usually made his creatures reflect the design of the arena, a detail that made them very visually appealing. Kestrel was also willing to go to more extremes than previous Engineers, which lead to much more entertaining games.

"The Gamemakers are in the conference room, Dr. Overwhill," said Katri.

"Wonderful. You are dismissed," replied Kestrel. Katri nodded and went back down the hallway. She'd get the chance to call him 'doctor' when the Gamemakers were leaving.

Kestrel entered the conference room. There, about twelve Gamemakers sat in his custom-designed rotating chairs, sent from District 1. Each chair had the face of a particularly vicious animal sculpted on the back. The head Gamemaker, Seneca Crane, sat in the furthermost chair.

'The Badger,' thought Kestrel. 'How fitting.' He did not have much love for Crane or any of the other Gamemakers, but he had to deal with them if he wanted to maintain his position.

"So, Dr. Overwhill, I assume you know the location of the next game?" began Crane. Kestrel nodded his head. "Wonderful. We've been discussing the creatures that will appear during the game, and we have come up with some preliminary designs. If you would, Trajan..." Crane gestured to a Gamemaker sitting next to a mobile holographic advice. Trajan activated the device, and three-dimensional models of several animals popped up. "These," said Crane, "are the proposed creatures. As always, we'll let you modify them in minor ways as you see fit. You can keep your own suggestions to yourself until the meeting ends."

'He acts like he owns my facility,' thought Kestrel. 'Oh, how I'd love to feed him to something.' Kestrel quickly shook these thoughts from his head, and tried to focus on Crane's presentation. He was going over the different animals they wanted to include in the arena. Overall, Kestrel thought it was a good list: a few primates, a couple bird species derived from vultures, and a multitude of larger-than-average insects. But one creature caught his eye. It was an eight-foot long pig, a semi-aggressive food source for Tributes. It struck Kestrel as incredibly boring, especially when compared to the unique creatures intended for the arena. 'I could probably make it more interesting,' thought Kestrel, as he began to consider different ideas.

"So, that concludes our presentation," said Crane. "Do you have any suggestions, Dr. Overwhill?"

"Why, yes. I do."
15212.title: Kestrel Overwhill, Genetic Engineer

choices: "John... You have been selected as an alpha test subject."
"Yes, John. This is indeed real... real enough to kill you."
15213.content:
John was walking towards the factory. It wasn't the most inspiring job, but he was happy to play his part in keeping Panem a vibrant country.

A dizzy spell hit him, and as he stopped and held his head he found himself engulfed in ... something.

It was like a sphere of flames, but instead of flames, there were glimpses into a different reality. A wilderness, far different from the dull grey concrete that surrounded him.

With a huff, the wilderness swept upwards, and the real world vanished.

Slowly John reached forward, expecting to find a cold invisible wall, or to trip over a hidden kerb. But it didn't happen.

His fingers found long branches, and soft leaves, and grass tickled his legs, the dew refreshing and waking them.

A voice boomed out of nowhere....
15213.title: John vanishes...

choices: From nowhere, an arrow flies past his ear.
"Can we be allies?" a worried voice asks from the tree line.
152131.content:
"If you survive these trials, and are sufficiently entertaining, then you can take pride in shaping the next official Hunger Games."

John looked around vainly trying to spot a loud speaker.

"Or rather you would take pride, if we didn't wipe your memory at the end."

"But... why..."

"Why you?" the voice interrupted. "You were selected at random, just like every contestant. Now if you've finished whining, you will find your supplies hidden behind the large fern covered rock."

Trailing his hand at his side, still unsure if this was real, John ventured round to the far side of the boulder, and found a sack of food, some tough wearing clothes, and a small assortment of weapons.

"To better test the games, we cut down the risk of casualties in the trial phase. Although, you are still in lethal danger... obviously."

Looking around, and listening intently there was only the sounds of the forest. At least, John assumed that was how a forest sounded. His trousers were already soaked from the dew on the grass, and his top wasn't really suitable either.

Stripping naked, he felt vulnerable, but quickly put on his new outdoorsy clothes, and felt better. Jamming the dagger and sheath into his belt, he rummaged through his supplies.
152131.title: "John... You have been selected as an alpha...

choices: Taking out his knife, he practised throwing it at trees.
Despite his care, John nicks a fingertip with his blade.
John assembles his bow, and examines the arrows.
1521313.content:
"This year, we are investigating ways of securing the future for the all Panem." The voice announced loftily.

John looked from side to side, wondering if the voice was inside his head, or announcing his location to the other trainee tributes.

"The contestants this year, will all be male." The voice continued, "At least to begin with... we are planning on making motherhood a more desireable career to ensure a healthy and vibrant population."

John froze, as it sank in.

"So..."

"So each weapon will still cut and kill, although wounds will tend to generate a female characteristic. The blades are coated with a layer of nanites, to give a girl a curvy ass... or wide hips... a generous bust... or a libido boost..."

The disembodied voice seemed to be enjoying this particular revelation.

"So the winner...."

"Yes, John... if you keep your manhood intact, and win through, you will have a harem of willing women... literal conquests -snort- Although, if you fail... you might find yourself eager to be pregnant, obedient, blessed with a submissive nature ... or if you prefer dead."

"You bastards..." he cursed, trying not to linger too much on what the next few days might involve.

"Just think of it as saving Panem... Who wouldn't want a willing, happy wife. You could become the poster girl for the whole country."

Growling in Frustration, he handled his cache of weapons more carefully, not wanting to accidentally cut himself.

"Welcome to the Game." the voice said.

In his heart, he knew the presence was gone.
1521313.title: John hears another announcement.

Walking up to her, Maisie asked her what was wrong:"What is it, Lilly?" She then took a closer look at what her cousin was pointing at. Upon seeing herself, she fainted. Jack ran up to them, a look of concern and angered fear on his face. Then he saw his hooded self, and asked:"What the heck is going on?! Who are you people, and why do those two look just like me and Maisie?!" The Other Stranger replied:"Like I said, Jack, we are travelers of a sort. We come from a parallel universe, and my companions here ARE you and Maisie. Our own Lilly was aboard the shuttlecraft that, heh, DROPPED us off here just now, filling the three of us in on your Lilly. Women are slaves that get treated like princesses and sexdolls at the same time, men are business owners that reject reason and preffer to brawl.
This district is a rural arcology... play freecities to find out more.

info.brief_description: It begins a 18 months before the events of the Hunger Games
info.description:
This is an idea I came up with after watching the Hunger Games movie, and my brother helped me come up with the beginning of it.
Rules: No pregnancy, Harry Potter, intercourse, or bad grammer. Swearing and gore are allowed (This is a story about conquering a dictatorship, after all!).
